ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Have Prices gotten out of hand
ygData.msgSnippet: I m very happy with my guild; but the majority are around my level or slightly higher.  We have three or four at 50+.  Right around the time one of our Rangers
ygData.messageBody:
I'm very happy with my guild; but the majority are around my level or
slightly higher. We have three or four at 50+. Right around the time one
of our Rangers hit 50 he was after something in Mistmore and got me a
Battledrum. Also a very good number in there 20's and 30's.

I'm in no big hurry to get singing - I believe Lambent is fine for my level
(41). When enough people in my guild are high enough to get such items I'm
sure they'll be free with them (doesn't hurt that I'm the highest level bard
in the guild - only one other primary is a Bard and he either hasn't been on
much lately...

Slyde
----- Original Message -----
From: "JasonF" <jasonf@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 23, 2000 2:40 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Have Prices gotten out of hand


> Geez you guys... Try and get into a cooperative, team-spirited guild. I
> logged on last night and had two different guildmates send me tells saying
> they had some Singing Steel boots for me if I still needed them.
>
> [51 Minstrel] Crier (Half Elf) <Seekers of Norrath> ZONE: work
>
>
> > Slyde wrote:
> > >Last night a 51 Wizard from my guild mentioned that he had a friend
> > (non-Bard) selling singing armor. I asked him what the guy wanted
> > per piece and he said 8K. I think this is absolutetly outragoes. I
> > mentioned to my wiz that I heard on this list some people mentioned
